meanings.definition: A type of salamander found in North America.
meanings.sent1: I saw an ewts by the pond yesterday.
meanings.sent2: The ewts crawled slowly across the forest floor.
meanings.sent3: Why did the ewts bring an umbrella to the pond? To stay dry!
meanings.sent4: The ewts blended into the leaves like a tiny green jewel.
meanings.sent5: The children were amazed by the colorful markings on the ewts.

meanings.definition: The third person singular form of the verb 'ewt', meaning to express disgust or revulsion.
meanings.sent1: He ewts whenever he sees spiders.
meanings.sent2: She always ewts at the sight of spoiled milk.
meanings.sent3: Why did the ewts refuse to watch the horror movie? It was too scary!
meanings.sent4: The smell was so bad, it made him ewts like a cartoon character.
meanings.sent5: The ewts on his face clearly showed his distaste for the food.

meanings.definition: A plural noun referring to a unit of weight used in India, equal to about 82 pounds.
meanings.sent2: They had to lift the heavy load of ewts together.
meanings.sent3: Why did the ewts go on a diet? They wanted to be lighter!
meanings.sent4: The burden felt like a thousand ewts on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The scale showed the exact weight in ewts.
